How to avoid a cold (this method has prevented years of colds for me):

1) Treat colds like allergies and use prevention methods

2) Leave the house when turning on central heating for the first time of the year. A change in dust, heat and humidity irritate the nasal tissue which cause drainage, drainage causes coughing, coughing and climate change irritates the throat. Put dust filters in your vents to help. Turn on a humidifier and use a barometer to keep humidity around 45-50. Use a space heater instead of central and layer your clothing.

3) When allergy season is in, cover your mouth and nose with a paper towel when walking from house to car and vice versa (especially if someone is cutting grass). If exposed to grass mold, dust, etc., do a sinus irrigation as soon as possible. Use anti-allergens on bed linens. Vacuum and dust regularly.

4) Keep hand sanitizer in your car and use it if you have to touch public doors, shopping carts, etc. Don’t touch your face! If someone in public sneezes, go the other way.

5) A probiotic can boost the immune system. Pro 15 Hyperbiotics is a good one.

A balanced diet whether sick or not is always good for your well being. I personally, have a simple method for combating the cold or flu virus.
This method has worked for me I have managed to avoid flu's and colds for 20 years +.

A Few Easy Steps;

Early detection is critical.( I have learn't to detect the flu virus in my body within an hour ) If need be, I take nothing stronger than Panadol to assist my body's defences in fighting the virus in the early stages and I use these medications sparingly as it gives my body time to adjust and overwhelm infection. However, if you are already suffering with the "flu the next step is;

The art of coughing! and controlling a running nose;

If you already have the virus and coughing is painful, try this exercise! Use the torso muscles to compress the lungs.(If you have
ever seen a" horse" cough,This is how you do it.) The old conventional way of coughing only irritates the back of your throat and causes inflammation
it doesn't do much in clearing your lungs of phlegm and fluid
if you "Horse cough"as I call it, through out the course of a day, at some point you will do a horse cough and without warning, whatever was in your lungs will be in your
mouth .
It sounds gross but it is extremely satisfying

If your nose is constantly running! Try rolling a tissue about the size of a cigarette or whatever feel s comfortable for you and insert it into your nostril replace it when it becomes saturated
this stops the area around your nose from becoming inflamed due to constantly blowing and wiping your nose

I hope it works for you.

Good Health.

It is "Feed a fever, starve a cold."  It has nothing to do with food...lol.  It means to stay warm and keep your body temperature up when you have a cold.  Of course you want to keep your body temp below danger levels.  "Fever" here refers to "running a temperature" and was chosen for the saying because "feed" and "fever" start with "F".  Also, and completely un related, there is quite a difference between a higher body temperature and a "fever".  They are not the same thing. 
Example: 
A.)  Body temp: 101 deg. F... feeling sick, staying home, taking meds, monitoring body temp, drinking fluids, should see a doctor.
B.)  Body temp: 101 deg. F... cold sweats, shivers, dizzy, possible hallucinations. in need of care pronto.

One is a fever.  Care to guess?

I was going to share this video until I looked up the [supposed] benefits of echinacea. This video seems to be way off the mark with that and in fact the research indicates little effects from its use regarding preventing or treating colds and flu and also some risk of allergic reaction. Manufacturers of products containing echinacea were found to have sloppy quality control (not surprising, I think most manufacturing is having issues with that these days) and one sample even had high levels of lead in it. The general recommendation printed on packaging now advises NOT giving it to children under 12.
Not saying it isn't any good, just saying that this video is at odds with other sources of information about it.

Science can be made fun and more interesting as ASAP does here, but medical issues are serious and deserve a more thorough treatment than ASAP gave this time round.
Also worth a mention about # 8, alcohol is a cough suppressant. So, that Hot Toddy does more than just make you feel better, it actually helps relieve one of your symptoms!

Hey AsapScience,
 
I have had a few questions that has kept me thinking for years about the possible answers to it. It would be great if you could make a video on these and let me know the answers. I know this message is too long and thank you in advance for your time in reading through this.

1.  I've always wondered on how the brain actually stores information? I mean like a computer does it store info bits, where 1s and 0s are made up two types of chemicals. If so, how can it store an image with a irregular shape, [Some people have good memory of what they see, don't they?]. And how does our brain store the billions of colors it sees everyday and still remember the color or the shape of your favorite item or the smell of the rose that you haven't smelt for ages, or the pain of having your hand cut by a blade, or the soft silky texture of your carpet or even the tune of a song that you just heard once but got stuck in your head. I mean all these can not just be chemical 1s and 0s. and if each color, shape, smell is coded by a unique chemical then how are combinations of them or just irregularities in them remembered by our brain?

2. How are just a bunch of atoms which make up our body perform calculus, division, complex maths, physics and also perceive pain, happiness and so on... I know that there are chemical receptors and hormones involved in the perception of feelings, but those are just a bunch of atoms and how are they able to bring about so many complex things that we can not artificially induce. Our brain just like air is just made of atoms, but it is also the "most complex computer in the world". So, can we actually assemble a fully working human baby just by combining atoms in the right proportion step by step first forming the DNA, then the cell organelles and then multiply it, provide different environments or hormones to it to specialize it to form neurons or cardiac muscles? and then arrange it to form a working human who will grow up to be just like us and have memory just like us?

3. How is light both a particle and a wave? In an Electromagnetic wave, the magnetic and electrical field are perpendicular to each other. So, does the particle form of light exist when the electrical and magnetic fields coincide? or does the photon just moove up and down along with its rectilinear propagation, making it a wave?

4. If we are on the look-out for planets with extra-terrestrial organisms beyond our solar system, then won't we be too late? Since the light takes at least few thousand years to reach us, won't we currently be receiving light from 1015 A.D.? And if the system was a million light-years away, then won't we be receiving light from a million years ago? If so, then we may not know the current status of the planet we are looking at. I mean it may have been sucked into a black hole a few thousand years ago when we are still looking at light from a billion years ago... So, isn't hunting for planets which support extra-terrestrial life futile? We may never know the current status of the planet or the organisms living on it right? So, we may dessert our resource-drained planet one day thinking that there is a planet out there that can support life, but we end up seeing just a black hole and with no resources to return. That would be the end of us...

5. Finally, how does our body now when to die? Does our brain send a unique chemical hormone that is released during death so that out organs stop functioning? If so, then how does our brain know when to die? Is is something to do with DNA which contains information on when to die? Or does our body just die? There have been cases where people know they are about to die that day, or cases where they sub-consciously do things without enthusiasm the whole day and die that night or the next day, or cases where they get last minute wishes before they die. So maybe one-time-use hormones act in this case?

I would like to know answers to these questions. And thank you again for your patience in reading through this long message.
